Vlad looked at Phoenix leaving the room. As the door closed, he looked 
at Starstorm.

Vlad: So, Freebirth, if you do not come to challenge me, what do you 
want of me?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> "Would you two excuse me?" Phoenix asks.  "I've got an oil-and-water 
> daiquiri to mix up."  This is a pretty transparent excuse to get out 
> of the room before the arguement flares up any further, and she 
> scoots out the door without really waiting for a reply.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Vlad smiled grimly.
> > 
> > Vlad: Then I shall take pleasure in ripping you apart piece by 
> piece, 
> > stravag bitch. The same way I killed all those spheroids that 
> thought 
> > they were above honor.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Airshadow Nightstar" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > Starstormn::
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Starstorm laughted again with a bitter tone "That's no true... 
we 
> > can die... 
> > > we're alive in our way... if damage is serious we die... " 
> > > 
> > > >From: "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...>
> > > >Reply-To: nbwrpg@y...
> > > >To: nbwrpg@y...
> > > >Subject: Re: In the dark...
> > > >Date: Thu, 21 Nov 2002 14:02:03 -0000
> > > >
> > > >Vlad nodded once.
> > > >
> > > >Vlad: Aff, but the warrior who believes in his cause is willing 
> to
> > > >give his life for it. Besides, you are machines. You can be 
> > rebuilt.
> > > >Thus, you should not fear death.
> > > >
> > > >--- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Starstorm:
> > > > >
> > > > > "A warrior alive is more useful than one death" replied
> > > > > Starstorm "You can fight and win other day... A wise Warrior 
> > knows
> > > > > when retreat and when fight"
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Vlad: Let warriors deal with the lower castes as they see 
> fit. 
> > As
> > > > > for
> > > > > > your friend, (he turns to Starstorm) battling a stronger 
> enemy 
> > and
> > > > > > dying is not a sign of stupidity, but a proof of honor and 
> > value.
> > > > > He
> > > > > > died a warrior.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> 
wrote:
> > > > > > > Phoenix::
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > "I -" Phoenix turns away.  Her voice becomes choking, as 
> she
> > > > > reaches
> > > > > > > into a past she'd much rather leave buried.  "I was a 
> slave 
> > of
> > > > > the
> > > > > > > Rogues.  They ... they thought it was good strategy to 
> blow 
> > up a
> > > > > > > bunch of innocent civilians .... It was a living 
> nightmare,
> > > > > watching
> > > > > > > them do their dirty work.  F-Flicker rescued me; that's 
> why 
> > I'm
> > > > > > here."
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > Starstorm::
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > "He fought like a tru idiot, you wanna meat Vlad" 
> replied
> > > > > > > > Startorm "He try to destroy a bot who was more 
powerful 
> > than
> > > > > him"
> > > > > > > and
> > > > > > > > looking to Phoenix asked curiously"Wher have you seen
> > > >masacres,
> > > > > > > have
> > > > > > > > you been a soldier once in your life?"
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> 
> > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > Phoenix shudders as old memories resurface.  
"Thanks, 
> > I've
> > > > > seen
> > > > > > > WAY
> > > > > > > > > too much killing in my life - at least the part I 
> > remember."
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> 
> wrote:

> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Vlad: At least, one of you fought like a true 
> warrior.
